title: (x) Brush scripts c 1940s movie posters - various {gang}
content:
i apologize if this has been asked before, but i searched and couldn't find anything.

i know that these were all hand lettered, but i am wondering if anyone can suggest a modern digital font that is similar to the brush lettering used in the titles on any of these posters.

thanks

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316232906im_/http:/typophile.com/files/143698~Laura-Posters_6243.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316232906im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Maltese_Falcon_5745.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316232906im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture-6_5668.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316232906im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Sherlock-Holmes-Faces-Death-Poster-C10283695_3661.jpeg)
author: hereandthere

comments.content: [Bello](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316232906/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000139#specimen) is quite good, I think, for "THE Maltese Falcon." Off the top of my head, I'd look through [Sudtipos'](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316232906/http:/sudtipos.com/) stuff; they have a number of script typefaces that might have a similar character.

[Flash](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316232906/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&startrow=1&records=20&currpage=1&totalrecords=12&searchby=&searchID=&searchletter=&searchstr=flash&font_categories_checkbox=font_name_search&fontRendererText=Sherlock+Holmes+)  
 [Holly Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316232906/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=holly%20script)  
 [Coronet](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316232906/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=Coronet)  
 [Futura Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316232906/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=futura%20script)  
 [Blizzard](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316232906/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=Blizzard)  
 [Metroscript](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316232906/http:/www.fontbros.com/cgi-bin/commerce.cgi?preadd=action&key=ALSO-MESR)  
and Mark Simonson's upcoming [Kinescope and Launderette](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316232906/http:/marksimonson.com/article/170/coming-soon-three-new-fonts) which is based on the titles from Laura! Incidentally, the best way to recreate these is with a hand drawn script and [Mark's your man](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316232906/http:/www.ms-studio.com/letteringdesign.html).

thanks reed and stephen.  
i would love to have mark letter this job, but i can guarantee that my client will not want be interested in paying for such gorgeous work. maybe one day.
_"A story as EXPLOSIVE as his BLAZING automatics!"_, lol.

You could also look at the House Industries Sign Painter collection

[http://www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=23&subpage=viewfonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316232906/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=23&subpage=viewfonts "http://www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=23&subpage=viewfonts")

or some of their other scripts such as League Night or Las Vegas Fabulous

[http://www.houseind.com/index.php?page=fontsbystyle&s=9](http://web.archive.org/web/20150316232906/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=fontsbystyle&s=9 "http://www.houseind.com/index.php?page=fontsbystyle&s=9")
